subject: Re: regular expression
body:
El Sábado 05 Mayo 2007 16:28, yaron@kahanovitch.com escribió:
> Hi,
>
> If you wish to read, change xml tree structure and create a xml string
> again than XML::TreePP
> (http://search.cpan.org/~kawasaki/XML-TreePP-0.19/lib/XML/TreePP.pm) should
> be helpfull.
>
> Yaron Kahanovitch
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "xavier mas" 
> To: beginners@perl.org
> Sent: 09:42:29 (GMT+0200) Asia/Jerusalem \u05e9\u05d1\u05ea 5 \u05de\u05d0\u05d9 2007
> Subject: Re: regular expression
>
> El Sábado 05 Mayo 2007 01:16, Ken Foskey escribió:
> > On Sat, 2007-05-05 at 01:01 +0200, xavier mas wrote:
> > > HI list!,
> > >
> > > I have a file with labels and a small text inside. When this text is
> > > different of a pattern text (n, for instance), this label must be
> > > deleted, for instance:
> > >
> > > f(more text)n(more
> > > text)mpl...
> > >
> > > (labels containing something different to 'n' must be deleted of the
> > > string.)
> > >
> > > How can I do this?
> >
> > Looks like XML,  xml::simple may help.
> >
> > Ken
>
> Thank you Ken. I'll look at it.
>
> Cheers,
>
> --
> Xavier Mas
>
> --
> To unsubscribe, e-mail: beginners-unsubscribe@perl.org
> For additional commands, e-mail: beginners-help@perl.org
> http://learn.perl.org/

Thamk you, Yaron.
-- 
Xavier Mas

--
